span.span: All Ripon USD Schools are extending the school dismissal due to the
Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) through the end of the 2019-20 school year.
As of now, Ripon USD Schools will remain on distance learning for remainder of the year.

span.a: 4-2-20 Letter Superintendent Robeson (include SJCOE & CDE Letters)

p.span: The Ripon Unified School District is located in San Joaquin County, the heart of the Central Valley of California. San Francisco and Sacramento are within one hour. Yosemite is within two hours, and Lake Tahoe is three hours away. The City of Ripon is committed to quality and controlled growth.
Congratulations to the team, coaches, staff, admin, and families!
Ripon USD and Ripon community are proud of you.

div.p: The Ripon Unified School District is committed to excellence and a quality education for all students. Our District is committed to lower class sizes at all grade levels and has a coordinated and articulated program from kindergarten through high school. There is a high level of parent and community involvement in the schools. A high level of support for the educational program is evident in the level of community-based financial support as well as donations of time and effort.
Students are served by five K-8 elementary schools (self-contained at all grade levels), one comprehensive high school and one continuation high school.

a.span: Job Openings at Ripon USD-Join our Team

div.p: Free Meals (Grab and Go) beginning tomorrow, Tuesday, March 17th, at Ripon Elementary School at 509 W. Main Street from 11 am to Noon Monday through Friday (March 17th until April 3rd). Each student must be present to receive a meal. Each student will receive lunch and breakfast for the next morning. Attached is an informational flyer. Any questions please call 209-599-6120.

Comidas Gratis (Grab and Go) a partir de mañana, martes 17 de marzo, en la Escuela Primaria Ripon en 509 W. Main Street de 11 am a mediodía de lunes a viernes (17 de marzo hasta el 3 de abril). Cada estudiante debe estar presente para recibir una comida. Cada estudiante recibirá almuerzo y desayuno para la mañana siguiente. Adjunto es un folleto informativo. Cualquier pregunta por favor llame al 209-599-6120.

p.span: Thank you so much for your generous donations and the SJCOE for organizing the event!

span.span: Dollar General Spreads LIteracy Support in Ripon Unified

div.p: Dollar General donated $50,000 to Ripon Elementary School through its Reading Revolution Program. Their representatives, Ripon Store Manager Sean O'Connell, Regional Director Tim Bartlett, and District Manager Shaun Wettgen presented the gift. We are humbled and thankful to have been chosen to receive this most generous donation.

Ripon Unified School District
304 N. Acacia Avenue
Ripon CA 95366
(209) 599-2131

This school district does not accept any form of discrimination harassment, intimidation, or bullying, based on actual or perceived characteristics of race or ethnicity, color, ancestry, nationality, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, political affiliation, marital or parental status, mental or physical disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, or genetic information, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local law, ordinance or regulation, in its educational program(s) or employment. No person shall be denied employment solely because of any impairment which is unrelated to the ability to engage in activities involved in the position(s) or program for which application has been made. If you need a reasonable accommodation to participate in the hiring process, Ripon Unified School District will provide you with one upon notice. Direct any complaints to: Dr. Ziggy Robeson at 304 N. Acacia Avenue, Ripon CA, 95366. Phone number is 209-599-2131.
